summary_detail.value: Three fires comprise the Sapphire Complex: Little Hogback, Goat Creek, and Sliderock fires. Mike Almas’ Northern Rockies Type II Incident Management Team (IMT) is managing the incident. The fires are burning in steep, rocky terrain between the Rock Creek and Upper Willow Creek drainages.      Little Hogback Fire: 30,929 acres, 30% contained.      Thursday, the fire continued to back downhill along the southwestern flank between upper Sheep Gulch and Capron Creek, and helicopters helped moderate fire behavior with water drops. Thunderstorms and associated wind moved much of the smoke out of the area, which could result in more active fire behavior. At this point, fire managers believe burnout operations in Capron Creek may be the only way to secure firelines in that area, but gusty winds prevented those plans for a second day in a row.
